greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n, k) = Numbers of ways to place k points on a triangular grid of side n so that no three of them are vertices of an equilateral triangle of any orientation. Triangle read by rows.
comment: The triangle T(n, k) is irregularly shaped: 0 <= k <= A240114(n). First row corresponds to n = 1.
The maximal number of points that can be placed on a triangular grid of side n so that no three of them form an equilateral triangle is given by A240114(n).
link: Heinrich Ludwig, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..138
example: There are T(5, 8) = 3 ways to place 8 points (x) on a triangular grid of side 5 under the conditions mentioned above:
x . . . x        . x x x x        x x x x .
results.author: _Heinrich Ludwig_, Apr 05 2014
